questions.text: What is the definition of online fraud?

options.text: Using the internet or phone to deceive people to obtain personal information or money
options.feedback: ✅ Correct. Online fraud is the act of using the internet or phone to trick others into giving personal information or money.
❌ Incorrect. Online shopping itself is not fraud.

options.text: Using social media to communicate with friends
options.feedback: ❌ Incorrect. Regular social activities are not fraud.

questions.text: Which of the following is a common online fraud method?

options.feedback: ✅ Correct. Scammers often pretend to be government officials to intimidate victims.
❌ Incorrect. Free services are not necessarily fraud.
❌ Incorrect. Normal greetings are usually unrelated to scams.

questions.text: Which type of information should never be shared over the phone or social media?

options.feedback: ✅ Correct. ID numbers are sensitive information.
❌ Incorrect. Hobbies are not sensitive information.
❌ Incorrect. Your favorite color cannot be used to steal your identity.

questions.text: What is the first thing to do when receiving a suspicious call?

options.feedback: ✅ Correct. Staying calm and hanging up helps avoid being scammed.
❌ Incorrect. You should never give out bank details.

options.text: Click the link provided by the caller
options.feedback: ❌ Incorrect. The link might lead to a scam site.

questions.text: Which is an example of caller ID spoofing?

options.text: A number very similar to the official bank number
options.feedback: ✅ Correct. Scammers use similar numbers to confuse victims.

options.text: A saved contact from your phone book
options.feedback: ❌ Incorrect. Known contacts are generally safe.
❌ Incorrect. Family numbers are rarely spoofed for scams.

questions.text: What is the purpose of using urgent language in scam calls?

options.text: To panic the victim and make them act immediately
options.feedback: ✅ Correct. Scammers want you to act without thinking.
❌ Incorrect. Urgent tone is rarely for good news.
❌ Incorrect. Discounts don’t require creating panic.

questions.text: What is the best thing to do when receiving a suspicious SMS with a link?

options.feedback: ✅ Correct. Avoid clicking suspicious links as they may be scam sites.
❌ Incorrect. Clicking could put you at risk.
❌ Incorrect. Don’t spread suspicious links.

questions.text: How can you verify if an investment website is real?

options.text: Check the domain and official registration info
options.feedback: ✅ Correct. Check the domain and confirm it’s registered with the Securities Commission or Central Bank.
❌ Incorrect. Website design can be faked easily.
❌ Incorrect. Reviews may be fake.

questions.text: Which of the following is an example of a fake website domain?

options.feedback: ✅ Correct. This suspicious domain is not Maybank’s official site.
❌ Incorrect. This is Maybank’s official website.
❌ Incorrect. Google is not an investment site.

questions.text: Why is a website without HTTPS unsafe?

options.text: Information may be intercepted by third parties
options.feedback: ✅ Correct. HTTPS encrypts data transmission to protect security.
❌ Incorrect. Speed is not the main issue.
❌ Incorrect. HTTPS has nothing to do with color.

questions.text: In Malaysia, which body regulates the registration of investment companies?

options.feedback: ✅ Correct. The Securities Commission regulates investment companies.
❌ Incorrect. The Tourism Ministry is not related to investment regulation.
❌ Incorrect. The football association doesn’t handle investments.

questions.text: What should you do if you suspect an investment website is suspicious?

options.feedback: ✅ Correct. Stop all actions to avoid losses.
❌ Incorrect. Even small amounts are risky.

options.text: Contact the other party for confirmation
options.feedback: ❌ Incorrect. Don’t contact non-official numbers.

questions.text: Why can’t online positive reviews be fully trusted?

options.feedback: ✅ Correct. Reviews may be fabricated.
❌ Incorrect. Not all reviews are true.

options.text: Because the reviews are too long
options.feedback: ❌ Incorrect. Length has nothing to do with authenticity.

questions.text: What should you do if you receive a call threatening you with a crime?

options.text: Hang up and verify through official channels
options.feedback: ✅ Correct. Only verify through official numbers.

options.text: Provide all information to avoid trouble
options.feedback: ❌ Incorrect. Never disclose sensitive information.
❌ Incorrect. That’s exactly what scammers want.

questions.text: What is the hotline number for reporting scams to CyberSecurity Malaysia?

options.feedback: ✅ Correct. This is the official hotline number.
❌ Incorrect. 999 is the general emergency number.
❌ Incorrect. 112 is the international emergency number.
